channel.title: Sicp on Bunyk Taras
channel.description: Recent content in Sicp on Bunyk Taras

item.title: SICP 1.2.2 Tree recursion
item.description: I like how they did not shown yet how to work with any data structures, but wrote function that behaves like a immutable array: (define (first-denomination kinds-of-coins) (cond ((= kinds-of-coins 1) 1) ((= kinds-of-coins 2) 5) ((= kinds-of-coins 3) 10) ((= kinds-of-coins 4) 25) ((= kinds-of-coins 5) 50))) Exercise 1.11 Functions should produce following sequence: 1, 2, 4, 11, 25, 59, 142 (Sequence A100550 in the On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences)

item.title: SICP1.2.1 Recursion & Iteration
item.description:
Ok, second subchapter is more challenging, so I’ll go by subsections.

Here is link to the chapter of the book I would solve today

item.title: SICP 1.1 The Elements of Programming
item.description: Decided to finally try and go through this book. Will try to keep journal with notes here.
